Hi

I am hoping someone can help me understand the use of @Before. As far
a=
s I know when JUnit runs tests a new instance is created for each
testcase.=


So why not initialise your test variables where you define them in the
cl=
ass or in the constructor. I can see no need for @Before.

Thanks

Ride
